page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Wath upon Dearne}is a small township that was an urban District in the old West Riding of Yorkshire but is now a Parish in the Metropolitian Borough of Rotherham in the County of South Yorkshire .It lies six miles north of Rotherham in squares 4,8 and 12 in our sector.There is a shopping centre ,banks,a public swimming bath,men's clubs and an entertainment hall.{West {Melton}occupies square 3 and part of 6 and 7 and although part of Wath Parish is self contained and has the church of the ecclesiastical parish of Brampton Bierlow.{BRAMPTON BIERLOW} occupies squares 1 and 2 .It is a parish in the borough of Rotherham and straddles the county boundary of Barnsley,It too is self contained and contains the community of Cortonwood colliery with its Parish Hall and Miners' Welfare Club.
